thread.title: White House suggests it's time for Biden to make a decision
thread.title_full: White House suggests it's time for Biden to make a decision

author: Ben Wolfgang
title: White House suggests it's time for Biden to make a decision
text:
Trail Tales White House suggests it’s time for Biden to make a decision Vice President Joe Biden pauses while speaking at the fifth annual Concordia Summit Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in New York, while briefly commenting on a deadly shooting at Umpqua Community College, in Roseburg, Ore., that happened earlier in the day. ... more > By Ben Wolfgang - The Washington Times - Monday, October 19, 2015 
The White House largely has been mum on Joseph R. Biden’s political future, but officials on Monday suggested that it may be time for the vice president to make a decision as more of the country’s attention turns to the 2016 presidential race. 
Rumors continue to swirl that Mr. Biden will announce over the next 48 hours whether he’ll seek the White House. White House Josh Earnest wouldn’t say much about Mr. Biden’s intentions, but he did hint that now is the time to decide. 
“I think everybody understands what the stakes are. Primarily, people understand this is an intensely personal decision for anybody to make,” Mr. Earnest told reporters. “We are into the fall, and that’s when more of the country’s attention and more of the debate focuses on who the next president might be. But ultimately, this will be a decision for the vice president to make.”
